Reviews.Title: Very good value
Reviews.Author: Dan McNamara
Reviews.Content: Good build for a lower cost lap top. This machine is used by a freshman University student and meets all of her computing (FB and E-mail) needs as well as word processing and reseaching the web for school work.

Reviews.Title: Strongly recommend
Reviews.Author: Adrienne Cook
Reviews.Content: With the numerical keypad added, the alphabetical keyboard is shifted a bit to the left. That, and the individual keys seem a little larger than I'm used to, so you find yourself having to stretch your fingers more than usual when typing. For someone with smaller hands (like my mom, who had a little bit of a hard time with it) or someone with carpal tunnel, this might not be the best choice. Otherwise, it just takes some getting used to. That being said, I was very happy to find an affordable Windows 7 laptop. It was fast,  easy to set up, not overloaded with annoying software, and I haven't had a single problem with it.

Reviews.Title: Acer Aspire
Reviews.Author: Joanne E Slavik
Reviews.Content: Easy to set up and use Just dissapointed it didn't come with at least a version of Word Even works would have been ok
